Lady Verzik Vitur is a vampyre who rules over Ver Sinhaza. She is the hostess as well as the final boss of the Theatre of Blood, and currently the strongest monster in Old School RuneScape.

Contents

  • 1 History
    • 1.1 Serving the Empire
    • 1.2 Serving Drakan
    • 1.3 Creating the new Theatre
  • 2 Dialogue
  • 3 Mechanics
  • 4 Drops
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 Gallery
  • 7 Trivia
  • 8 References

History[edit | edit source]

Serving the Empire[edit | edit source]

Verzik Vitur was the head of the Vitur family on the vampyre homeworld of Vampyrium, and arrived on Gielinor alongside many other vampyres during the Second Age brought by Zaros, who the vampyres refer to as the "Stranger from Afar". Before her departure, she had domesticated a large number of nylocas, which she brought with her to Gielinor. Verzik was fond of culture and collecting, amongst her prized artefacts were the Scythe of Vitur, a most valuable weapon and heirloom of the ancient and revered founder of House Vitur, and the Ghrazi rapier, which she inherited from her father. She supposedly took a role in the military of the Zarosian Empire as she was granted an Avernic defender during her service.

Serving Drakan[edit | edit source]

Lady Vitur was on good terms with the Drakan family, especially with Lowerniel Drakan, and continued supporting them even after Drakan's participating in Zamorak's rebellion against Zaros.

During Lowerniel Drakan's conquest of Hallowvale, Verzik worked with Ranis Drakan, capturing a Saradominist Justiciar and tortured him for several days. The Justiciar revealed a secret tunnel underneath the royal castle, which allowed Lowerniel's forces to capture King Ascertes. Although Vanescula believed that Lowerniel did not like having the war end so early, he nonetheless rewarded Verzik with Efaritay's castle. She also collected the armour of the fallen Saradominist soldiers and kept them in her treasury. Verzik would later oversee a massive renovation of the castle, which then became known as Ver Sinhaza.

Due to her fondness of "playing" with her food, she often demanded entertainment on the spot from her vampyre soldiers. She eventually became bored of this and had the Theatre of Blood constructed, where powerful creatures would be placed inside for challengers to fight under the pretense of freedom from blood tithes should they prevail. Although some challengers may have prevailed against her lineup of creatures, she personally finished off those who made it to her.

She assisted Lowerniel once again during the Misthalin - Morytania War during the Fourth Age, when Drakan launched an attack on the kingdom west of the River Salve. Although the kingdom of Misthalin was victorious and the Seven Priestly Warriors managed to establish a blessing on the River Salve making it impossible for vampyres to cross, Lord Drakan rewarded Verzik for her support by giving her the Sanguinesti Staff, which he had crafted himself.

Creating the new Theatre[edit | edit source]

Verzik continued to keep in touch with Ranis during this time, and took in the warped Serafina into her Theatre, believing it to be wrong to abandon her after all the work Ranis did and called her The Maiden of Sugadinti. The addition of the Maiden prompted Verzik to renovate the Theatre, replacing all of her previous challenges. Ranis gave Verzik some arachnid eggs from a nest north of Darkmeyer, as Lowerniel believed she could use them in her breeding program.

As she replaced her challenges, the next addition she obtained was a grotesque creation, given to her from a supposedly insane vampyre called "The Butcher". She proceeded to name the creation the Pestilent Bloat, believing it fitting for a crude creation. Verzik then showed Ranis a Nylocas Athanatos, a creation made possible with the special arachnid eggs. She then showed Ranis the Nylocas chamber, complaining that the Nylocas were too weak individually and wanted them to be stronger when alone. Ranis then suggested the bark of a hespori, as they had regenerative properties.

Ranis then gifted Verzik a dark beast called Sotetseg. The beast's power over the Shadow Realm brought back memories of the Zarosian Empire as a result of Ranis exploring more of the Shadow Realm. However, the project failed, so Sotetseg was given to Verzik, who took it in, believing it to be a fine addition to the new Theatre. As the pair continued to tour the new Theatre, Lowerniel had sent Xarpus, the last king of the Yarasa, to Verzik. Verzik was surprised to see the Yarasa, believing them to have gone extinct. She wondered how Lowerniel had returned to Vampyrium, but Ranis did not know. Verzik then showcased her finest work, a small queen Nylocas. However, the spider bit her and died, much to her disdain. She complained of a sickness, prompting the doctor Vulcan Orvoros to pay a visit. Although he helped her, he discovered the symptoms had returned and tried to persuade her to visit his office in Darkmeyer, but she refused. It is later revealed that the Nylocas bite was more fatal than she had thought, and Verzik herself was killed by the queen upon maturing, who subsequently took on her form as a disguise, explaining why she had gained weight and her inability to defend herself from conventional weaponry. The queen immediately had Vulcan killed to prevent witnesses and declared that the vampyres' rule was over, and that the Nylocas would take their place. She most likely had the Butcher killed too, as he appeared to be aware that Verzik was dead.

Despite her sudden obesity, none of the other vampyres appeared to take note that something with Verzik was off, most likely as a result of the queen inheriting her personality.

After opening the Theatre of Blood to all, Verzik encountered a particular set of outside humans that bested all creatures within and eventually made it to her. Although she was impressed with their skills and thoroughly entertained by their performance, she stated that she couldn't let them leave and attempted to kill them. Despite her best efforts (including the use of her vampyre-nylocas form), the group proved to be too strong, and Verzik was forced to flee, transforming into a bat, much to her apparent embarrassment. Despite this, she eventually returned to see more challengers, even if they were the same ones who could best her in battle.

During Ranis' hunt for the Myreque, Verzik gifted him an Abomination, claiming that once it had acquired the smell of a desired target, it would relentlessly pursue them until they died.

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.
Click here for a list of other transcripts that this NPC speaks in.

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

To initiate the fight, a player must first talk to Verzik Vitur. She will have 3 phases:

  • During phase 1, players in the raid must take it in turn to use the Dawnbringer's special attack in order to harm Verzik. Any other weapon will have a much lower chance of hitting and will also be capped on damage. Ranged/mage is capped at 3 and melee is capped at 10 damage. It is mandatory to hide behind a pillar, as failing to do so can result in fatal damage. Pillars will also collapse after several attacks and deal heavy damage to anyone next to them when it collapses.
  • During phase 2, Verzik will leave her throne and fly to the middle of the room, collapsing all remaining pillars in the room. Players next to her have a chance of being bodyslammed away which stuns them, and she also tosses out bombs at the players' positions which deal heavy damage if they are not avoided. She can summon multiple Nylocas. When this happens she also tosses a slow purple projectile which can be avoided but if it lands on the tile the player's on it can deal up to 78 damage. This purple projectile also transforms into Nylocas Athanatos which will heal her and can be removed by attacking them once with a poisoned weapon to inflict a heavy poison hit before despawning. The common Nylocas will follow a player and explode if they reach their target for 63 damage, but will also explode after a set amount of time. As her health falls below 35%, she will start using blood spells to heal her, which will drain the player's prayer if prayed against, and periodically summon two Nylocas Matomenos which she will kill off if they persist too long, and heal her for the amount of health they had left. During the first three seconds after she summons them, any damage inflicted will heal her instead.
Verzik Vitur transforms into a spider hybrid.
  • During phase 3, Verzik's true form will be shown, a half spider, half vampyre. She is now mobile and uses all three forms of combat, her ranged attack consisting of barbs and her magic a single blue projectile. These are considered to be her "Auto" attacks. She now has four special attacks. The first she will summon common Nylocas during the fight like in the previous phase, and uses new abilities. She can charge up a powerful attack, creating "safespots" which players can stand on to protect them from this attack. Each "safespot" only works for one player, so they cannot stand on the same tile to protect themselves. She can also go to the centre of the room and fling webs around the chamber, binding players if they are stuck on them. Trapped players can be set free by having other players attack the web, which has 10 health. Otherwise, they will be freed after a set amount of time but take heavy damage in the process. She can also launch a green projectile which must be bounced between every player of the team or the player who is targeted will take heavy damage. The order of these attacks are in a set order. The first round of special attacks is Nylos, followed by webs, safe spots, and green projectile. There are four "auto" attacks between each special attack. When she reaches 20% of her health, she will increase her attack speed, and summon a purple magical tornado for each player in the room, which will constantly follow them. If they are hit by the tornado, they will take damage equal to 50% of their current health, healing and empowering Verzik in the process. The tornado will also heal Verzik if a player dies to another attack.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
3 June 2021
(update | poll)

Hard mode and entry mode versions of the Theatre of Blood encounters added.

16 May 2019
(update)

A bug where Verzik would target a dead player was fixed.

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • Artwork of Verzik Vitur

  • Concept art of Verzik

  • Several concepts of Verzik

  • Concept art of Verzik prior to the nylocas bite, by Mod Jerv

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • "Vérzik" directly translates to "[they are] bleeding" in Hungarian, and "vitur" translates to "wise" in Icelandic.
  • The concept of Verzik Vitur was inspired by the character Ursula from Disney's 1989 animated film The Little Mermaid.[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ghost's Twitter account. 2 May 2018. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ghost: "I love Ursula, she was definitely an inspiration :)"

'''Lady Verzik Vitur''' is a [[vampyre]] who rules over [[Ver Sinhaza]]. She is the hostess as well as the final boss of the [[Theatre of Blood]], and currently the strongest monster in ''Old School RuneScape''. ==History== ===Serving the Empire=== Verzik Vitur was the head of the [[Vampyre Houses#House Vitur|Vitur family]] on the vampyre homeworld of [[Vampyrium]], and arrived on [[Gielinor]] alongside many other [[vampyre]]s during the [[Second Age]] brought by [[Zaros]], who the vampyres refer to as the "Stranger from Afar". Before her departure, she had domesticated a large number of [[nylocas]], which she brought with her to Gielinor. Verzik was fond of culture and collecting, amongst her prized artefacts were the [[Scythe of Vitur]], a most valuable weapon and heirloom of the ancient and revered founder of House Vitur, and the [[Ghrazi rapier]], which she inherited from her father. She supposedly took a role in the military of the [[Zarosian Empire]] as she was granted an [[Avernic defender]] during her service. ===Serving Drakan=== Lady Vitur was on good terms with the Drakan family, especially with [[Lowerniel Drakan]], and continued supporting them even after Drakan's participating in [[Zamorak]]'s rebellion against Zaros. During [[Lowerniel Drakan]]'s conquest of Hallowvale, Verzik worked with [[Ranis Drakan]], capturing a Saradominist [[Justiciar]] and tortured him for several days. The Justiciar revealed a secret tunnel underneath the royal castle, which allowed Lowerniel's forces to capture [[King Ascertes]]. Although Vanescula believed that Lowerniel did not like having the war end so early, he nonetheless rewarded Verzik with Efaritay's castle. She also collected the [[Justiciar armour|armour]] of the fallen [[Saradomin]]ist soldiers and kept them in her treasury. Verzik would later oversee a massive renovation of the castle, which then became known as [[Ver Sinhaza]]. Due to her fondness of "playing" with her food, she often demanded entertainment on the spot from her vampyre soldiers. She eventually became bored of this and had the Theatre of Blood constructed, where powerful creatures would be placed inside for challengers to fight under the pretense of freedom from blood tithes should they prevail. Although some challengers may have prevailed against her lineup of creatures, she personally finished off those who made it to her. She assisted Lowerniel once again during the {{RSL|Misthalin - Morytania War}} during the [[Fourth Age]], when Drakan launched an attack on the kingdom west of the [[River Salve]]. Although the kingdom of [[Misthalin]] was victorious and the [[Seven Priestly Warriors]] managed to establish a blessing on the River Salve making it impossible for vampyres to cross, Lord Drakan rewarded Verzik for her support by giving her the [[Sanguinesti Staff]], which he had crafted himself. ===Creating the new Theatre=== Verzik continued to keep in touch with Ranis during this time, and took in the warped Serafina into her Theatre, believing it to be wrong to abandon her after all the work Ranis did and called her [[The Maiden of Sugadinti]]. The addition of the Maiden prompted Verzik to renovate the Theatre, replacing all of her previous challenges. Ranis gave Verzik some arachnid eggs from a nest north of Darkmeyer, as Lowerniel believed she could use them in her breeding program. As she replaced her challenges, the next addition she obtained was a [[Pestilent Bloat|grotesque creation]], given to her from a supposedly insane vampyre called "[[The Butcher (vampyre)|The Butcher]]". She proceeded to name the creation the Pestilent Bloat, believing it fitting for a crude creation. Verzik then showed Ranis a [[Nylocas Athanatos]], a creation made possible with the special arachnid eggs. She then showed Ranis the Nylocas chamber, complaining that the Nylocas were too weak individually and wanted them to be stronger when alone. Ranis then suggested the bark of a [[hespori]], as they had regenerative properties. Ranis then gifted Verzik a [[dark beast]] called [[Sotetseg]]. The beast's power over the Shadow Realm brought back memories of the Zarosian Empire as a result of Ranis exploring more of the Shadow Realm. However, the project failed, so Sotetseg was given to Verzik, who took it in, believing it to be a fine addition to the new Theatre. As the pair continued to tour the new Theatre, Lowerniel had sent [[Xarpus]], the last king of the [[Yarasa]], to Verzik. Verzik was surprised to see the Yarasa, believing them to have gone extinct. She wondered how Lowerniel had returned to Vampyrium, but Ranis did not know. Verzik then showcased her finest work, a small queen Nylocas. However, the spider bit her and died, much to her disdain. She complained of a sickness, prompting the doctor [[Vulcan Orvoros]] to pay a visit. Although he helped her, he discovered the symptoms had returned and tried to persuade her to visit his office in Darkmeyer, but she refused. It is later revealed that the Nylocas bite was more fatal than she had thought, and Verzik herself was killed by the [[Nylocas Queen|queen]] upon maturing, who subsequently took on her form as a disguise, explaining why she had gained weight and her inability to defend herself from conventional weaponry. The queen immediately had Vulcan killed to prevent witnesses and declared that the vampyres' rule was over, and that the Nylocas would take their place. She most likely had the Butcher killed too, as he appeared to be aware that Verzik was dead. Despite her sudden obesity, none of the other vampyres appeared to take note that something with Verzik was off, most likely as a result of the queen inheriting her personality. After opening the Theatre of Blood to all, Verzik encountered a particular set of outside humans that bested all creatures within and eventually made it to her. Although she was impressed with their skills and thoroughly entertained by their performance, she stated that she couldn't let them leave and attempted to kill them. Despite her best efforts (including the use of her vampyre-nylocas form), the group proved to be too strong, and Verzik was forced to flee, transforming into a bat, much to her apparent embarrassment. Despite this, she eventually returned to see more challengers, even if they were the same ones who could best her in battle. During Ranis' hunt for the Myreque, Verzik gifted him an [[Abomination]], claiming that once it had acquired the smell of a desired target, it would relentlessly pursue them until they died. ==Dialogue== {{hastranscript|npc}} ==Mechanics== To initiate the fight, a player must first talk to Verzik Vitur. She will have 3 phases: *During phase 1, players in the raid must take it in turn to use the [[Dawnbringer]]'s special attack in order to harm Verzik. Any other weapon will have a much lower chance of hitting and will also be [[Maximum damage cap|capped]] on damage. Ranged/mage is capped at 3 and melee is capped at 10 damage. It is mandatory to hide behind a pillar, as failing to do so can result in fatal damage. Pillars will also collapse after several attacks and deal heavy damage to anyone next to them when it collapses. *During phase 2, Verzik will leave her throne and fly to the middle of the room, collapsing all remaining pillars in the room. Players next to her have a chance of being bodyslammed away which stuns them, and she also tosses out bombs at the players' positions which deal heavy damage if they are not avoided. She can summon multiple Nylocas. When this happens she also tosses a slow purple projectile which can be avoided but if it lands on the tile the player's on it can deal up to 78 damage. This purple projectile also transforms into [[Nylocas Athanatos]] which will heal her and can be removed by attacking them once with a poisoned weapon to inflict a heavy poison hit before despawning. The common Nylocas will follow a player and explode if they reach their target for 63 damage, but will also explode after a set amount of time. As her health falls below 35%, she will start using blood spells to heal her, which will drain the player's prayer if prayed against, and periodically summon two [[Nylocas Matomenos]] which she will kill off if they persist too long, and heal her for the amount of health they had left. During the first three seconds after she summons them, any damage inflicted will heal her instead. [[File:Verzik Virtur transforms.gif|frame|Verzik Vitur transforms into a spider hybrid.]] *During phase 3, Verzik's true form will be shown, a half spider, half vampyre. She is now mobile and uses all three forms of combat, her ranged attack consisting of barbs and her magic a single blue projectile. These are considered to be her "Auto" attacks. She now has four special attacks. The first she will summon common Nylocas during the fight like in the previous phase, and uses new abilities. She can charge up a powerful attack, creating "safespots" which players can stand on to protect them from this attack. Each "safespot" only works for one player, so they cannot stand on the same tile to protect themselves. She can also go to the centre of the room and fling webs around the chamber, binding players if they are stuck on them. Trapped players can be set free by having other players attack the web, which has 10 health. Otherwise, they will be freed after a set amount of time but take heavy damage in the process. She can also launch a green projectile which must be bounced between every player of the team or the player who is targeted will take heavy damage. The order of these attacks are in a set order. The first round of special attacks is Nylos, followed by webs, safe spots, and green projectile. There are four "auto" attacks between each special attack. When she reaches 20% of her health, she will increase her attack speed, and summon a purple magical tornado for each player in the room, which will constantly follow them. If they are hit by the tornado, they will take damage equal to 50% of their current health, healing and empowering Verzik in the process. The tornado will also heal Verzik if a player dies to another attack. ==Drops== {{DropsTableHead}} {{DropsLine|name=Verzik vitur - patient record|quantity=1|rarity=Always|raritynotes=Only received if players do not have it stored in their bank.}} {{DropsTableBottom}} {{Reflist|group=r}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 3 June 2021 |update = Theatre of Blood: New Modes |poll = A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM |change = Hard mode and entry mode versions of the Theatre of Blood encounters added. }} {{Subject changes |date = 16 May 2019 |update = Farming Improvements and Rebalancing Existing Content |change = A bug where Verzik would target a dead player was fixed. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Gallery== Verzik Vitur artwork.jpg|Artwork of Verzik Vitur Verzik Vitur concept.png|Concept art of Verzik Verzik Vitur concepts.png|Several concepts of Verzik Verzik Vitur (human form) concept art.jpg|Concept art of Verzik prior to the nylocas bite, by [[Mod Jerv]] ==Trivia== *"Vérzik" directly translates to "[they are] bleeding" in Hungarian, and "vitur" translates to "wise" in Icelandic. *The concept of Verzik Vitur was inspired by the character Ursula from Disney's 1989 animated film ''{{WP|The Little Mermaid (1989 film)|The Little Mermaid}}''.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ghost|url=https://twitter.com/Jagex_Ghost/status/991773208356507648|date=2 May 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/gKkoK|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=I love Ursula, she was definitely an inspiration :)}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Succession|predecessor=[[TzKal-Zuk]]|title=[[Strongest monster|Strongest monster in ''RuneScape'']]|successor=Incumbent}} {{Theatre of Blood}} {{Vampyres}} {{A Taste of Hope}} {{A Night at the Theatre}}
